result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy R Dawley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy R Dawley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy R Dawley was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Jeremy R Dawley was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive.
**Per order signed 07-18-16 release privileges for work is granted.

Concurrent.
If defendant complies with all the conditions of probation prior to the 18 months, the agent may request an earlier release.
Probation may be transferred to Nebraska, if they are willing to accept him.
If defendant stays in Wisconsin, Probation review hearing December 18, 2015 at 1:30 in Br. 36.

miscConds.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges. Bail  to apply.  Remaining costs/surcharges to be paid during probation.  If not paid, civil judgment to be entered.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No contact with victim unless approved by the Court.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.

received, signed and filed granting the defendant work release.
Copies forwarded to Attorney Thelen.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. spc
Defendant by Atty. Thelen's request for electronic monitoring and/or Huber.

Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Court suggested that the department look at testing so often.  Defendant has been tested 5 times with negative tests.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to counts 2 and 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered counts 2 and 3; and the penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, on count 4 dismissed and read in.
As to counts 1 and count 4 as amended:  Defendant pled guilty
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement by:  LeeAnne H.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 3 months in the House of Correction as to count 4, consecutive, with credit for 2 days served.  
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 18 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 45 days in the House of Correction as to count 1; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges from the bail on deposit, remaining costs and surcharges to be paid during probation; if not paid,  civil judgment to be entered.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
If the defendant complies with all of the conditions of probation prior to the 18 months, the agent may request an earlier release.
.
Probation may be transferred to Nebraska, if they are willing to accept him.
.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
If the defendant stays in Wisconsin, the next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in court with attorney Kristina Lee Thelen.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests matter be set for Plea & Sentencing. Bail remain in effect, defendant advised he can travel within the United States of America, but may not leave the country.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Notice of Retainer & Cover Letter, Copy returned to sender.

Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared PRO SE.  Defendant in process of retaining counsel.  Court ordered time limits regarding right of substitution tolled to next court date.  Case adjourned for a Status of Counsel Date before branch 23.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jeremy R Dawley in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
